title: Castlemorton Common Walks

images.title: Trevor Rickard / Castlemorton Common
images.caption: Castlemorton Common in late summer. One of the best viewpoints for the Malvern Hills. Here looking north-west from the lane which crosses the common.

images.title: Cattle on Castlemorton Common by Trevor Rickard, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cattle on the common.

images.title: Trevor Rickard / View over the car park from Swinyard Hill
images.caption: View over the car park from Swinyard Hill. The Malvern Hills Conservators car park at the end of the Gullet Quarry lane is below, with Castlemorton Common on the left. Large areas of Rosebay Willowherb can be found on the Malverns in the summer.

images.title: Castlemorton Common by Jonathan Billinger, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Castlemorton Common

images.title: Pond, Castlemorton Common by Bob Embleton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pond

images.title: Track across Castlemorton Common by Trevor Rickard, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: An autumn view with sheep.

images.title: The edge of Castlemorton Common at Welland by David Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The edge of Castlemorton Common at Welland

images.title: Swinyard Hill by John Allan, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Swinyard Hill. Near the car park on the western side of the common you'll find this fine viewpoint.

description: This walk explores Castlemorton Common near the village of Castlemorton in Worcestershire. The common is a popular place for a walk with miles of trails and fine views towards the Malvern Hills which lie just to the west of the site. There's also grazing cattle, lots of wildflowers in the summer, ponds, woodland and wildlife to enjoy. This circular walk starts from the Swinyard Hill public car park on the south western side of the common. From here you can pick up the trails heading north and then east across the expansive common. The Worcestershire Way Link runs through the common. You could pick up the trail and follow it west to climb to Herefordshire Beacon and British Camp. Here you will find an Iron Age Hillfort and some glorious views over the common and the surrounding countryside.
